results.title: Love or Hate Valentine’s Day? Either Way, There Are Movies for You.
results.abstract: Depending on how you feel about Valentine’s Day, these streaming picks will either melt or break your heart.

results.title: Wanda Sykes, Amy Schumer and Regina Hall to Host the Oscars
results.abstract: The comic actresses are in final talks for the job, which the producer Will Packer is adding back to the ceremony. The event had been hostless for the past three years.
results.byline: By Kyle Buchanan and Nicole Sperling

multimedia.copyright: Photographs by Rodin Eckenroth/Getty Images; Jamie Mccarthy/Getty Images; Jerod Harris/Getty Images
Photographs by Rodin Eckenroth/Getty Images; Jamie Mccarthy/Getty Images; Jerod Harris/Getty Images
Photographs by Rodin Eckenroth/Getty Images; Jamie Mccarthy/Getty Images; Jerod Harris/Getty Images

results.title: ‘Somewhere With No Bridges’ Review: Of Men and Memories
results.abstract: Charles Frank’s documentary about a Martha’s Vineyard man tries to turn a shadow into a portrait.

multimedia.caption: Beauty shot: Ben Madeiras and Lucas Landers, in Charles Frank’s documentary “Somewhere With No Bridges.”
Beauty shot: Ben Madeiras and Lucas Landers, in Charles Frank’s documentary “Somewhere With No Bridges.”
Beauty shot: Ben Madeiras and Lucas Landers, in Charles Frank’s documentary “Somewhere With No Bridges.”

results.title: Mifune’s Transcendent Films, With and Without Kurosawa
results.abstract: Yes, the Japanese team was one of cinema’s great collaborations. But Film Forum’s salute to Toshiro Mifune shows that he was a superb actor no matter who was in the director’s chair.

multimedia.caption: Toshiro Mifune in “Samurai Rebellion,” one of the highlights of his non-Kurosawa films.
Toshiro Mifune in “Samurai Rebellion,” one of the highlights of his non-Kurosawa films.
Toshiro Mifune in “Samurai Rebellion,” one of the highlights of his non-Kurosawa films.

results.title: Whether He’s Talking ‘Amélie’ or ‘Bigbug,’ Jean-Pierre Jeunet Doesn’t Hold Back
results.abstract: The French director is candid about his fights with Harvey Weinstein and his reasons for working with Netflix. And he can’t hide his joy about a rerelease of “Amélie.”

multimedia.caption: Jean-Pierre Jeunet in Paris this month. His new film, “BigBug,” is debuting on Netflix.
multimedia.copyright: Julien Mignot for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Jean-Pierre Jeunet in Paris this month. His new film, “BigBug,” is debuting on Netflix.

results.title: Ivan Reitman, Director of ‘Ghostbusters,’ Is Dead at 75
results.abstract: He injected giant marshmallow boogeymen and toga parties into popular culture with movies that also included “National Lampoon’s Animal House” and “Stripes.”
results.byline: By Neil Genzlinger and Christine Chung

multimedia.caption: The producer and director Ivan Reitman on the set of his “National Lampoon’s Animal House” in 1978 in Studio City, Calif. His movies, especially the early ones, often featured memorably outrageous scenes.

The producer and director Ivan Reitman on the set of his “National Lampoon’s Animal House” in 1978 in Studio City, Calif. His movies, especially the early ones, often featured memorably outrageous scenes.

The producer and director Ivan Reitman on the set of his “National Lampoon’s Animal House” in 1978 in Studio City, Calif. His movies, especially the early ones, often featured memorably outrageous scenes.

results.title: Five International Movies to Stream Now
results.abstract: This month’s picks include an intimate Belgian-Cameroonian documentary portrait, a film about the uprooting of massive trees and a newly released 2004 feature by Hirokazu Kore-eda.

multimedia.caption: Delphine in Rosine Mbakam’s documentary “Delphine’s Prayers.”
Delphine in Rosine Mbakam’s documentary “Delphine’s Prayers.”
Delphine in Rosine Mbakam’s documentary “Delphine’s Prayers.”

results.title: Watch Jennifer Lopez Perform in ‘Marry Me’
results.abstract: The director Kat Coiro narrates a sequence from her film featuring the actress and Maluma.

results.title: ‘Improbable Journey’: How a Movie From Tiny Bhutan Got an Oscar Nod
results.abstract: “Lunana: A Yak in the Classroom” was filmed on a shoestring budget in a remote Himalayan village. It’s now an Academy Award nominee, a first for Bhutan.
results.byline: By Chencho Dema and Mike Ives
des_facet: Lunana: A Yak in the Classroom (Movie)

multimedia.caption: The director Pawo Choyning Dorji, right, talked with Pem Zam, a young first-time actress from rural Bhutan, during the shooting of his film “Lunana: A Yak in the Classroom.”
The director Pawo Choyning Dorji, right, talked with Pem Zam, a young first-time actress from rural Bhutan, during the shooting of his film “Lunana: A Yak in the Classroom.”
The director Pawo Choyning Dorji, right, talked with Pem Zam, a young first-time actress from rural Bhutan, during the shooting of his film “Lunana: A Yak in the Classroom.”

results.title: ‘Icahn: The Restless Billionaire’ Review: Right on the Money
results.abstract: The war stories of the famed financier Carl C. Icahn power this deft documentary portrait.

multimedia.caption: The investor Carl C. Icahn is the subject of the documentary “Icahn: The Restless Billionaire.”
The investor Carl C. Icahn is the subject of the documentary “Icahn: The Restless Billionaire.”
The investor Carl C. Icahn is the subject of the documentary “Icahn: The Restless Billionaire.”

results.title: Isabelle Huppert Doesn’t Watch Her Past Films, but She Will Discuss Them
results.abstract: The Berlin International Film Festival is honoring the superstar of art house cinema with a lifetime achievement award. She took us through some career highlights.

multimedia.caption: “I was never intimidated by anyone, at least no directors,” Isabelle Huppert said. “If you are intimidated things become impossible.”
multimedia.copyright: Celeste Sloman for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: “I was never intimidated by anyone, at least no directors,” Isabelle Huppert said. “If you are intimidated things become impossible.”

results.title: What Makes a Good Hercule Poirot? (It’s More Than the Little Gray Cells.)
results.abstract: Agatha Christie’s Belgian sleuth has inspired many interpretations, none exactly true to her novels, including Kenneth Branagh’s approach in “Death on the Nile.”

results.title: ‘Oscar Peterson: Black + White’ Review: Never Mind the Talking Heads
results.abstract: The flashing fingers of this jazz piano icon, and his mesmerizing tracks, are all the perspective we need.

multimedia.caption: Oscar Peterson, as seen in the documentary “Oscar Peterson: Black + White.”
Oscar Peterson, as seen in the documentary “Oscar Peterson: Black + White.”
Oscar Peterson, as seen in the documentary “Oscar Peterson: Black + White.”

results.title: Watching This Movie Taught Me It Was OK to Fail
results.abstract: Gena Rowlands’s destabilizing brilliance in “Opening Night” turned out to be the reassurance I needed.

results.title: Douglas Trumbull, Visual Effects Wizard, Dies at 79
results.abstract: His technical savvy was on display in films like “2001: A Space Odyssey,” “Star Trek: the Motion Picture,” “Close Encounters of the Third Kind” and “Blade Runner.”
des_facet: Close Encounters of the Third Kind (Movie)

multimedia.caption: The visual effects expert Douglas Trumbull on the set of Steven Spielberg’s “Close Encounters of the Third Kind” (1977), one of three movies for which his work earned him Academy Award nominations.
The visual effects expert Douglas Trumbull on the set of Steven Spielberg’s “Close Encounters of the Third Kind” (1977), one of three movies for which his work earned him Academy Award nominations.
The visual effects expert Douglas Trumbull on the set of Steven Spielberg’s “Close Encounters of the Third Kind” (1977), one of three movies for which his work earned him Academy Award nominations.

results.title: Why a Kanye West Documentary Took Two Decades to See the Light
results.abstract: The new three-part film “Jeen-yuhs: A Kanye Trilogy” has been in the works since the early 2000s. In an interview, the directing duo Coodie & Chike discuss its long journey to Netflix.

multimedia.caption: A new documentary about Kanye West focuses on the lead-up to and immediate aftermath of his 2004 debut album, “The College Dropout.”
A new documentary about Kanye West focuses on the lead-up to and immediate aftermath of his 2004 debut album, “The College Dropout.”
A new documentary about Kanye West focuses on the lead-up to and immediate aftermath of his 2004 debut album, “The College Dropout.”

results.title: Bob Wall, Martial Arts Master Who Sparred With Bruce Lee, Dies at 82
results.abstract: He taught thousands of senseis how to run a dojo, all the while trading kicks onscreen with Lee and Chuck Norris.

multimedia.caption: Bob Wall, right, with Bruce Lee in a fight scene from “Enter the Dragon” (1973). The film made martial arts movies an indelible part of American pop culture.
Bob Wall, right, with Bruce Lee in a fight scene from “Enter the Dragon” (1973). The film made martial arts movies an indelible part of American pop culture.
Bob Wall, right, with Bruce Lee in a fight scene from “Enter the Dragon” (1973). The film made martial arts movies an indelible part of American pop culture.

results.title: ‘The In Between’ Review: Love Never Dies
results.abstract: A teenage girl thinks that her dead boyfriend’s spirit is reaching out from the Great Beyond.

multimedia.caption: Joey King as Tessa and Kyle Allen as Skylar in “The In Between.”
Joey King as Tessa and Kyle Allen as Skylar in “The In Between.”
Joey King as Tessa and Kyle Allen as Skylar in “The In Between.”

results.title: ‘Bigbug’ Review: Rise of the Machines
results.abstract: A squabbling family is locked in its home by robots in this overlong artificial-intelligence comedy on Netflix.

multimedia.caption: Claude Perron plays a robot housekeeper in “Bigbug.”
Claude Perron plays a robot housekeeper in “Bigbug.”
Claude Perron plays a robot housekeeper in “Bigbug.”

results.title: ‘Playground’ Review: A Creation Story
results.abstract: In this stunning Belgian drama, a little girl and her brother go to school, read, write, fight and learn some brutal lessons about life.

multimedia.caption: Family ties: Maya Vanderbeque, left, and Günter Duret play brother and sister in Laura Wandel’s “Playground.”
Family ties: Maya Vanderbeque, left, and Günter Duret play brother and sister in Laura Wandel’s “Playground.”
Family ties: Maya Vanderbeque, left, and Günter Duret play brother and sister in Laura Wandel’s “Playground.”

results.title: ‘Marry Me’ Review: Putting ‘I Do’ on the To-Do List
results.abstract: As a pop star who weds a math teacher in a stunt wedding, Jennifer Lopez is all business. But the original songs shine.

multimedia.caption: Jennifer Lopez, left, portrays a pop star who weds a teacher played by Owen Wilson in the romantic comedy “Marry Me.”
Jennifer Lopez, left, portrays a pop star who weds a teacher played by Owen Wilson in the romantic comedy “Marry Me.”
Jennifer Lopez, left, portrays a pop star who weds a teacher played by Owen Wilson in the romantic comedy “Marry Me.”

results.title: ‘The Sky Is Everywhere’ Review: Amid Grief, Blossoms of Joy
results.abstract: Josephine Decker unlooses a slipstream of adolescent passion and anguish in this radiant drama about a musician grieving the loss of her big sister.

multimedia.caption: Jacques Colimon, left, with Grace Kaufman in “The Sky Is Everywhere.”
Jacques Colimon, left, with Grace Kaufman in “The Sky Is Everywhere.”
Jacques Colimon, left, with Grace Kaufman in “The Sky Is Everywhere.”

results.title: Hear Lata Mangeshkar in These Four Streaming Films
results.abstract: Because Mangeshkar lent her voice to several generations of Bollywood stars, these movies double as a highlight reel for Hindi cinema.
des_facet: Lagaan: Once Upon a Time in India (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Aamir Khan and Gracy Singh in “Lagaan” (2001), which features singing by Lata Mangeshkar.
Aamir Khan and Gracy Singh in “Lagaan” (2001), which features singing by Lata Mangeshkar.
Aamir Khan and Gracy Singh in “Lagaan” (2001), which features singing by Lata Mangeshkar.

results.title: ‘I Want You Back’ Review: Scheming Hearts
results.abstract: Jenny Slate and Charlie Day play strangers who team up to win back their exes in this pleasantly run-of-the-mill rom-com.

multimedia.caption: In “I Want You Back,” Gina Rodriguez plays Anne, an English teacher who dumps Peter (Charlie Day), a manager at a nursing home company.
In “I Want You Back,” Gina Rodriguez plays Anne, an English teacher who dumps Peter (Charlie Day), a manager at a nursing home company.
In “I Want You Back,” Gina Rodriguez plays Anne, an English teacher who dumps Peter (Charlie Day), a manager at a nursing home company.

results.title: ‘Indemnity’ Review: Fires Everywhere
results.abstract: This South African thriller trades plausibility and originality for a worthy substitute: a great deal of fun.

multimedia.caption: Jarrid Geduld in “Indemnity,” a film by Travis Taute.
Jarrid Geduld in “Indemnity,” a film by Travis Taute.
Jarrid Geduld in “Indemnity,” a film by Travis Taute.

results.title: ‘Catch the Fair One’ Review: The Fight of Her Life
results.abstract: The real-life boxer Kali Reis plays a pugilist in search of revenge.

multimedia.caption: Kali Reis in Josef Kubota Wladyka’s “Catch the Fair One.”
Kali Reis in Josef Kubota Wladyka’s “Catch the Fair One.”
Kali Reis in Josef Kubota Wladyka’s “Catch the Fair One.”

results.title: ‘Worst to First: The True Story of Z100 New York’ Review: An FM Radio Sensation
results.abstract: A look back at a time when “excellence in broadcasting” was taken seriously, including interviews with Joan Jett, Jon Bon Jovi and other stars.
des_facet: Worst to First: The True Story of Z100 New York (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Scott Shannon in the studio in “Worst to First: The True Story of Z100 New York.”
Scott Shannon in the studio in “Worst to First: The True Story of Z100 New York.”

results.title: ‘Minamata’ Review: A Crisis Slowly Revealed
results.abstract: In Andrew Levitas’s newest film, Johnny Depp portrays a real-life photojournalist who helped expose an ecological disaster in 1970s Japan.

multimedia.caption: Johnny Depp, center, in “Minamata.”
Johnny Depp, center, in “Minamata.”
Johnny Depp, center, in “Minamata.”

results.title: ‘Blacklight’ Review: He’s Off the Books (But You’ve Read This One Before)
results.abstract: Liam Neeson plays a top-secret operative in an action movie that teeters between subverting the genre and obeying convention.

multimedia.caption: Liam Neeson in “Blacklight.”
Liam Neeson in “Blacklight.”
Liam Neeson in “Blacklight.”

results.title: ‘The Pact’ Review: A Faustian Bargain
results.abstract: When a baroness summons a young poet to her estate and suggests they make a deal, he should have hightailed it back down the road.

multimedia.caption: In “The Pact,” Thorkild Bjornvig (Simon Bennebjerg) is an aspiring poet and the author Karen Blixen (Birthe Neumann) is his mischievous mentor.
In “The Pact,” Thorkild Bjornvig (Simon Bennebjerg) is an aspiring poet and the author Karen Blixen (Birthe Neumann) is his mischievous mentor.
In “The Pact,” Thorkild Bjornvig (Simon Bennebjerg) is an aspiring poet and the author Karen Blixen (Birthe Neumann) is his mischievous mentor.

results.title: ‘The Unmaking of a College’ Review: School’s Out Forever?
results.abstract: This documentary tells the story of a liberal-arts college that faced an existential crisis, and of how students fought back against the way potentially drastic decisions were made.

multimedia.caption: Hampshire College students organizing in the documentary “The Unmaking of a College.”
Hampshire College students organizing in the documentary “The Unmaking of a College.”
Hampshire College students organizing in the documentary “The Unmaking of a College.”

results.title: ‘Death on the Nile’ Review: Dead in the Water
results.abstract: Kenneth Branagh’s second adaptation of Agatha Christie’s Hercule Poirot stories forgets the simple pleasures of ensemble excess and pure messing about.

multimedia.caption: From left, Gal Gadot, Emma Mackey and Armie Hammer in “Death on the Nile.”
From left, Gal Gadot, Emma Mackey and Armie Hammer in “Death on the Nile.”
From left, Gal Gadot, Emma Mackey and Armie Hammer in “Death on the Nile.”

results.title: ‘The Fabulous Filipino Brothers’ Review: For Better or for Worse
results.abstract: The Abasta family of California is celebrating a wedding. The Basco family writes, directs and stars in this warm, welcoming comedy.

multimedia.caption: From left, Darius Basco, Aida Basco, Dante Basco, Dionysio Basco, Cheryl Tsai, Derek Basco and Iluminada Monroy in “The Fabulous Filipino Brothers,” directed by Dante Basco.
